item.title: iPad Goes on Sale
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:14, topic:335382”][quote author=Thug-life link=topic=431768.msg3172094#msg3172094 date=1270516283]
iPad can run more than one process at a time!
[/quote]

I thought it used the same OS as iTouch/iPhone, it doesn’t?[/quote]

Yep, which is my point. Those can do multitasking, you can listen to the iPod while browsing the web, reading mail, you could open up a few sites then minimise the web browser to let them load and read your mail etc. You can multi task on ALL of the standard operating system applications.

What Apple do is stop people multitasking on third party applications, for which i assume is to allow each application access to as much system resources as possible in order to run properly. For me, there are many things wrong with the iPhone to the point it frustrates me, but multitasking is something that i believe has already been done in the iPhone to more or less the point it needs to be. I mean yeah, they probably could start letting developers put a flag on their application which says they can be multitasked, and the SDK by default won’t allow them to use more than a certain amount of system resources, and then allow 5 or 6 of those applications that are developed for that to be ran at the same time.

For the iPad however, that needs proper multitasking. But for the iPhone, like i said - it already has the multitasking i think it needs. I was just being nit picky when i originally said what i said, because technically it can run multiple Applications at a time, just not the third party ones, which for the ipad, needs to be fixed imo.

Read full topic
